bug.author: access2rohit
bug.summary: BytePS w/ MXNet doesn't work w/o docker container
bug.description:
If i try to run on bare machine i cannot run the MXNet example: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bytedance/byteps/blob/master/docs/step-by-step-tutorial.md#mxnet>https://github.com/bytedance/byteps/blob/master/docs/step-by-step-tutorial.md#mxnet</denchmark-link>
But if I use the container provided then I am able to run the example. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Ubuntu 16.04 DLAMI EC2 instance p2.8xlarge (8 k80gpus) pip install mxnet-cu100mkl pip install byteps==0.2.0 git clone --recursive https://github.com/bytedance/byteps.git ~/byteps run following commands on shell:
<denchmark-code> export NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0,1,2,3 # gpus list export DMLC_WORKER_ID=0 # your worker id export DMLC_NUM_WORKER=1 # one worker export DMLC_ROLE=worker
export DMLC_NUM_SERVER=1 export DMLC_PS_ROOT_URI=10.0.0.1 export DMLC_PS_ROOT_PORT=1234
bpslaunch python3 ~/byteps/example/mxnet/train_imagenet_byteps.py --benchmark 1 --batch-size=32 </denchmark-code>
See error as shown in logs
Expected behavior To run mxnet example Logs <denchmark-code>(mx_byteps) ubuntu@ip-172-31-85-4:~$ bpslaunch python byteps/example/mxnet/train_imagenet_byteps.py --benchmark 1 --batch-size=32 BytePS comments.comment: Can you use pip3 install byteps==0.2.2? What is the MXNet version number?
MXNet 1.6.0 cu100-mkl python and pip are by default linked to python 3.6

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/access2rohit>@access2rohit</denchmark-link> Can you try byteps==0.2.2? It has better compatibility with various versions of gcc. You can compare your installation steps with those in the dockerfile. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bytedance/byteps/blob/master/docker/Dockerfile#L46>https://github.com/bytedance/byteps/blob/master/docker/Dockerfile#L46</denchmark-link>
Can you try run with export LD_PRELOAD=/usr/lib/libtcmalloc_minimal.so.4? It enables better memory management. You may need to install it by apt update && apt install libtcmalloc-minimal4.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ymjiang>@ymjiang</denchmark-link>
